intro: Armeria sancta, commonly known as the sacred thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Armeria sancta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
